title: Manager Home Childcare Services
description:
Manager Home Childcare Services

Location:  various locations throughout Ottawa South 

Office Location – Metcalfe, ON

Work Term: Permanent, Full Time, 35 hours per week

RURAL FAMILY CONNECTIONS is a non-profit, licensed childcare operator serving children from 0 to 12 years of age. Licensed under the Ministry of Education, we proudly serve an expanding South Ottawa community, including South Gloucester (Findlay Creek, Blossom Park), Riverside South, Osgoode Ward (Greely, Metcalfe, Vernon, Kenmore, Osgoode), Rideau Ward (North Gower, Kars), South Keys, Hunt Club, the surrounding rural areas and the area stretching north to Heron Road between Riverside Drive and just east of Conroy Road. We work alongside our home care providers to provide inclusive, play-based programming in their homes to ensure the best learning and growing environment for the children and families we serve. 

Position

We are continuing to grow and expand at RFC!

This will allow for an expansion of high-quality, licensed childcare services for families and will allow us to meet families' ever-changing and unique needs across our Region. Reporting to the Executive Director, this individual will be responsible for leading our organization to continue our successful licensed home childcare, including the recruitment of home childcare providers and children. This individual will be responsible for overseeing and monitoring licensed home childcare consultants, providing opportunities for professional networking and resourcing and pedagogical support. This individual will ensure management practices that reflect the organization's philosophy, promote quality early childhood education and care, provide a safe and supportive work/play environment, promote positive relations with families and partners, and demonstrate sound legislative understanding and adherence.

Responsibilities: 

Applicant expectations: 

  • Develop and implement a marketing strategy to recruit new home childcare providers, including influencing existing unlicensed home care providers to become licensed;
  • Recruiting of new families to our licenced agency; 
  • Promote community awareness and highlight the benefits of becoming licensed home childcare;
  • Develop and maintain strategic community partnerships;
  • Develop and implement a process to onboard licensed home childcare providers to include; external postings, interviews, screening protocols, vulnerable sector checks and licensing/administrative support;
  • Conduct initial home visits to ensure a provider is ready to open;
  • Review and coordinate signing of all applicable agreements and paperwork between the home childcare provider and Rural Family Connections.
  • Attend monthly manager meetings; 
  • Ensure all documentation, policies, and procedures are current and up to date; 
  • Evaluate programming and home childcare consultants; 
  • Promotion of licensed home childcare;
  • Assist home childcare providers in filling any vacancies within their homes;
  • Work with community partners to develop strong community relations.

Requirements: 

  • Strong verbal and non-verbal communication skills in English; French an asset
  • Excellent organizational, planning and empowering skills
  • Effective conflict resolution and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to develop and maintain positive community connections
  • Professional work ethic and ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Enthusiastic, positive, and solution-focused
  • Advanced computer skills, knowledge of marketing through social media
  • College Diploma or University Degree in Early Childhood Education
  • University degree in relevant area; childcare, social services, business 
  • Minimum of 5 years of management experience
  • Experience in Home Childcare would be an asset
  • Experience with licensing under the Ministry of Education
  • Current Standard First Aid and CPR Level C qualification
  • Good standing with College of Early Childhood Educators. 
  • Current, valid driver's license and vehicle 
  • Strong understanding of Child Care and Early Years Act, How Does Learning Happen? ELECT, Universal childcare initiative. 


Please email Lee Stanistreet your cover letter and resume to leestanistreet.rfc@gmail.com. Please put in the subject, Manager- Home Childcare Services.

Closing Date: May 13th, 2022

description:
Robertson is the School of New Work. Our vision is for everyone to have a good life through a prosperous and fulfilling career. Robertson’s mission is to empower our students with the most relevant training and up-to-date industry insights to thrive in a modern work environment.


At Robertson, motivated students can advance their education at their own schedule. The Robertson team assists both during and after graduation to ensure students have the tools they need to succeed in a new career. Robertson team members are guides for our students on their career path as they navigate their college and educational experiences during their time at Robertson.


Education Canada Group (the parent company of Robertson College) is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our inclusive work environment and encourage people from all walks of life to apply. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone feels seen, heard and valued. We embrace our team's differences and know that diversity in our team is the strength that drives our success. We want you to feel welcomed, energized, challenged, and engaged while having fun. Come and grow with us! If you are someone who loves the highs and lows of doing meaningful work with like-minded team members, we’d like you to join us.

  • Record student attendance and grades
  • Attend onsite practicum placements and complete checklists
  • Develop and maintain a supportive learning community
  • Provide guidance and support to adult learners
  • Evaluate student performance fairly, promptly and consistently.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Alberta ECE level 3 is required
  • 5 years of experience working in a childcare setting required
  • Experience delivering training programs for professional and educational purposes an asset
  • Experience with Learning Management Systems (D2L preferred) and asset

SKILLS, ABILITIES, and ATTITUDES

  • Demonstrates confidence, a positive approach and a strong work ethic
  • Ability to plan, organize and prioritize tasks
  • Must be dependable, reliable and punctual
  • Ability to problem solve and process information
  • Team oriented and adaptable
  • Demonstrates multicultural sensitivity and awareness
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Proven organizational skills and ability to complete assignments timely and accurately with minimal supervision
  • Experience with andragogical training and teaching an asset

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Remote interview process, virtual meetings

title: Travailleur(euse) social(e) – Clientèle âgée à domicile – Lachine – Temps complet
description:
Description

Le CIUSSS de l’Ouest-de-l’Île-de-Montréal est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) travailleur(euse) social(e) pour combler un poste temporaire à temps complet. L’emploi est basé à l’Ex-Hôpital générale de Lachine. Le/la candidat(e) sélectionné(e) sera majoritairement appelé(e) à travailler en ressources intermédiaires auprès des personnes en perte d’autonomie. L’emploi nécessite donc des déplacements sur le territoire du CIUSSS de l’Ouest-de-l’Île-de-Montréal.

À titre de travailleur(se) social(e) au sein de la Direction du programme de soutien à l’autonomie des personnes âgées, vous assurerez la meilleure prise en charge d’une clientèle ayant un profil gériatrique accompagné d’un état de santé physique et psychosocial complexe, mais présentant un potentiel de maintien à domicile.

Vos interventions viseront à favoriser l’autonomie des personnes, à soutenir leurs capacités de prendre des décisions pour elles-mêmes, à maintenir leur qualité de vie le plus longtemps possible dans le milieu et l’entourage qui leur est familier et à faciliter l’accès aux services auxquels elles ont droit. Votre rôle sera d’assurer la continuité des services au client et la concertation des membres de l’équipe multidisciplinaire quant à l’élaboration et au déploiement du plan d’intervention.

Vos Fonctions Vous Appelleront à
  • Évaluer la situation psychosociale du client ainsi que ses besoins par la cueillette de données essentielles subjectives et objectives ainsi que par l’analyse de ces données;
  • Prioriser les besoins du client, identifier ses incapacités, ses limites et les limites de son réseau;
  • Procéder à la planification des services appropriés en tenant compte de la disponibilité de ressources;
  • Déterminer les partenaires à mobiliser (au sein de l’établissement, au sein du réseau, dans le secteur communautaire, etc.) et négocier l’accès aux ressources;
  • Intervenir au plan du fonctionnement social des résidents, notamment par rapport aux interactions entre ces derniers et leur environnement (milieu de vie, famille et proches, collectivité) dans le but d’assurer le développement optimal des capacités affectives, sociales et spirituelles et de maintenir ou améliorer la qualité de vie et le fonctionnement social;
  • Réaliser la coordination des services mis en place en assurant une communication optimale entre les différents partenaires impliqués (rôle d’agent de liaison);
  • Effectuer un monitorage des services reçus par le client pour assurer la continuité des interventions;
  • Réaliser un suivi clinique permettant de vérifier l’atteinte des objectifs du plan d’intervention et le réajustement de celui-ci, s’il y a lieu;
  • Réaliser les démarches et l’accompagnement nécessaires lors de la mise en place d’un régime de protection;
  • Exercer les fonctions transversales de représentation des intérêts du client et de défense de ses droits;
  • Travailler au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire avec qui vous partagerez le savoir qui vous distingue et participer aux rencontres d’équipe.
Saisissez dès maintenant cette opportunité de travailler au sein d’une équipe dynamique et dédiée au bien-être de nos aînés, tout en participant activement au développement d’une offre intégrée de services de qualité optimale!

En vous joignant au CIUSSS de l’Ouest-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, vous profiterez d’une multitude d’avantages :
  • Salaire concurrentiel auquel des primes peuvent s’ajouter (de 27,08$ jusqu’à 47,98$/heure);
  • Des bénéfices marginaux (vacances, journées de maladie) accumulés au prorata des journées travaillées;
  • Participation, avec l’employeur, à un régime de retraite à prestation déterminée assurant un revenu de retraite fiable;
  • Protection par des assurances collectives (vie, maladie, salaire);
  • Accès, pour vous et votre famille, à un programme d’aide aux employés gratuit;
  • Accès à de la formation continue (formation formelle, supervision, coaching, etc.);
  • Vastes possibilités de développement de carrière à l'interne.
Exigences

Disponibilité recherchée : 8h00 à 16h00, du lundi au vendredi.

Le/la Candidat(e) Recherché(e)
  • Doit détenir un baccalauréat ou une maîtrise en travail social ou diplôme jugé équivalent par une autorité compétente*;
  • Doit être inscrit(e) à titre de travailleur(se) social(e) au Tableau de Ordre des travailleurs sociaux et des thérapeutes conjugaux et familiaux du Québec;
  • Doit être apte à établir une relation thérapeutique avec une clientèle francophone et anglophone;
  • Doit avoir de l’expérience avec une clientèle gériatrique ou en soutien à domicile, un atout;
  • Doit posséder une connaissance des enjeux et problématiques liées au vieillissement (troubles cognitifs, démence, deuil, dynamiques familiales, régimes de protection, etc.);
  • Doit avoir un permis de conduire valide et accès à un véhicule pour les déplacements (kilométrage remboursé);
  • Sait faire preuve de patience et d’empathie.
Vous vous reconnaissez dans ce profil? Déposez une candidature sans tarder!
  • NB: Tout diplôme obtenu à l'étranger doit avoir fait l'objet d'une Évaluation comparative des études effectuées hors du Québec auprès du Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l'Intégration. Prière d'inscrire le résultat de l'évaluation dans votre CV, sans quoi votre candidature pourrait ne pas être considérée.
Remarques

Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais ne communiquerons qu’avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.

Le CIUSSS de l'Ouest-de-l'Île-de-Montréal applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi et invite les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques, les femmes et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Les personnes handicapées peuvent également nous faire part de leurs besoins particuliers relativement au processus de sélection pour l'emploi sollicité afin de faciliter l'étude de leur candidature.

title: Child Care Centre Relief
company: Umbrella Family and Child Centres of Hamilton
description:
For over 30 years, Umbrella Family and Child Centres of Hamilton has offered high-quality programs to young children and their families. We operate full-day early learning and childcare centres for infant, toddler and preschool children, as well as extended-day programs before and after school for kindergarten and school age children in over 30 locations throughout the Greater Hamilton Area.

We pride ourselves on being a leading childcare organization, committed to high quality programs that are inclusive, accessible, and promote learning and growth.

Who are we Looking For?

We are looking for a Child Care Centre Relief to compliment our team!

This is a unique position for Umbrella Family! The successful candidate will be used as relief, to cover staffing needs at any of our Umbrella Family locations. This role does not have a static schedule but provides a variety of shift and location coverage.

This position will be scheduled approximately 28.5 to 37.5 hours a week.

Why work for Us?

Benefits to Working for the Umbrella Family and Child Centres:
  • Competitive wages and benefits
  • RRSP matching program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Unionized Environment
  • Generous vacation and sick time allotments
  • Employees with children get priority on childcare waiting list
  • Working in a fun, collaborative and positive environment with top professionals

What are we Looking For?

To be considered for this role, the right candidate will have the following qualifications:

Experience: Minimum 1-year experience working directly with children OR Related experience in a childcare setting, working with school age children

Education:
  • Diploma in Early Childhood Education
  • We may consider those with the following Diploma: Child & Youth Worker, OCT – Teacher, Education Assistant, Social Worker, Recreation & Leisure

Certifications
  • Member in good standing with College of ECE’s
  • Standard First Aid with CPR level C
  • Satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Police Check
  • Proof of up to date immunization for TB, Tetanus and MMR
  • Proof of COVID-19 Vaccinations

Skills: Demonstrates awareness and knowledge of How Does Learning Happen is an asset

Characteristics
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast paced environment
  • Flexible environment with minimal supervision
  • An advocate for diversity, equality, and inclusion

What will you be doing?

You will be responsible for the ongoing operation of a high-quality childcare centre for children ages 12 months to 12 years of age.

The successful candidate will:
  • Establish goals, plan, implement and evaluate developmentally appropriate experiences to enhance children’s cognitive, physical, social and emotional development in accordance with Ministry of Education’s How Does Learning Happen
  • Supervising children in your care at all times
  • Organize indoor and outdoor play areas, space, equipment, and materials to create a warm and welcoming environment
  • Conduct daily checks on each child in his/her group as per Ministry requirements, complete documentation and notify the Supervisor of any unusual circumstances
  • Maintain a safe, warm, and caring environment in which a high-quality child care program can operate, and maintain professional relationships with Hamilton Wentworth District School Board faculty
  • Work to provide age-appropriate developmental activities to enhance the individual and group’s cognitive, physical, social, cultural, and emotional development

Our Pandemic Response

The health and safety of our employees is a top priority at Umbrella Family, using all necessary precautions with COVID-19 procedures. To protect our employees and potential employees, we have implemented:
  • Remote interview process
  • PPE training and requirements for all employees
  • Active and passing screening at all childcare centres
  • Limiting access to only essential visitors
  • Enhanced cleaning measures at all locations

In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available to applicants to support them in all aspects of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Homemaker
description:
Homemaker (Casual)

Health and Senior Services Department

About Fort Mckay

The Fort McKay First Nation (FMFN) is composed of over 800 band members, including those of Cree and Dene heritage, with approximately 400 members residing in the hamlet of Fort McKay — a community located approximately 65 km north of Fort McMurray. Fort McKay offers the best of both worlds: remote northern life for the nature lover and proximity to a large city of about 70,000 people with all the amenities you need.

About The Role

We are looking for passionate and caring Homemakers to join our multidisciplinary Health care team! Under the direction of the Nursing Supervisor, the Homemaker is responsible to ensure that the standards of cleanliness are achieved and maintained on a consistent basis to provide the highest level of client satisfaction, within established time limitations.
  • These are casual positions with part-time and full-time hours available, including working days, evenings and weekends and range from 8 to 12 hours shifts.

Key Responsibilities

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Ensure the housekeeping needs of the client are met and respected.
  • Ensures the personal and spiritual needs of the client are respected.
  • Transport clients to either medical appointments, personal banking, shopping and/or social events.
  • Plan and prepare meals adhering to any special dietary needs or requests.
  • Provide care and companionship for individuals and families during periods of incapacitation, convalescence or family disruption.
  • Attend job related workshops, seminars and conferences as requested, to keep current on the developments or changes in the area of Home Care.
  • Maintain safety procedures as required by FMFN.
  • Follow Health and Safety principles in delivering care to clients in the community while working effectively and cooperatively with others.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Key Requirements
  • High School Diploma
  • A valid Class Five (5) driver’s licence is required
  • Valid St. Johns First Aid certification
  • Knowledge in safe food handling, nutrition and meal preparation
  • Must be physically capable of performing required duties. This includes occasional lifting up to 50 lbs, repetitive walking, bending, squatting, twisting motion and kneeling is required
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and execution on work quality
  • Ability to speak and/or understand Cree and/or Dene is an asset
  • Experience in a First Nations community is a definite asset

You can also check us out on social media -> Facebook & LinkedIn

title: Childcare Attendant
description:
Ideal candidates enjoy working with groups of children and enjoy creating a fun, active environment for them to grow in. You will provide an inviting, friendly and safe environment for all visitors and ensure all programming is age appropriate. Your primary role is to get and keep members. True to our company core value of Safety, all FFC employees wear face masks while working.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
  • Provide excellent customer service at all times.
  • Provide structured activities and programs for children.
  • Communicate member complaints and incident reports within 24 hours to management.
  • Make sure childcare room and toys/accessories are kept clean at all times.
  • Adhere to Fitness Formula Core Values at all times.
  • Punctual attendance for shifts is required.
Desired Qualifications
  • experience in day care, teaching or children’s care facility.
Physical Requirements
  • Physical requirements include: walking and standing during the entire shift (often 4-8 hours), climbing stairs, kneeling to clean floors, pushing and pulling objects, lifting and moving objects (up to 50 lbs.), and cleaning.

title: ECE Early Childhood Educator / Childcare
description:
Registered Early Childhood Educator RECE

This job description describes general terms and responsibilities that employees will be expected to undertake. However, the job or duties described may vary or be amended from time to time without changing the level of responsibility associated with the post due to business needs.


Responsibilities

• Maintain regulated and required documentation, reporting and record-keeping

• Plan and develop program webs in line with children’s interests. Monthly calendars will be provided so that teachers are able to create a program that meets all targets to engage all children

• Programming must be child-directed, and teacher supported in accordance with Lullaboo’s “How Does Learning Happen” guidelines

• Support children with emotional, physical, or behavioural problems and help develop their social, emotional, cognitive and physical skills

• Provide support for children in the classroom and enable them to fully participate in activities

• Maintain up-to-date emergency cards, attendance, and health and safety checks

• Work with professionals, such as Speech Therapists, Occupational Therapists, and Early Interventionists as necessary

• Support children through transitions in and out of the classrooms

• Manage and maintain an orderly classroom

• Meet all classroom ratios as outlined in CCEYA

• Participate and interact in team meetings and workshops

• Perform other duties and responsibilities as required from time to time


Specifications

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels with children, coworkers, and parents

• Ability to utilize Lullaboo’s computer system for all documentation, reporting, and classroom operations

• Supportive attitude, and ability to provide emotional, physical, and/or behavioural support to children

• Highly organized, with strong attention to detail

• Strong collaborator and team player

• Ability to take initiative in and out of the classroom

• Strong problem-solving skills


Qualifications

• Registered with, and in good standing with the College of Early Childhood Educators

• Satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Criminal reference check (within the last six months)

• Valid Standard First Aid and CPR Level C

• Ability to lift children up to the age of 5
